alert.note: Alert for Northumberland; Snyder (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 5:56PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHUMBERLAND AND SNYDER COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of 20 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 556 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from Sunbury to near Selinsgrove and moving east at 30 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Stonington around 600 PM EST. Trevorton around 610 PM EST. Shamokin, Urban and Elysburg around 615 PM EST. Marshallton around 620 PM EST. Kulpmont around 625 PM EST. Mount Carmel and Leck Kill around 630 PM EST. Motorists traveling along US-15 in southern Northumberland County shoudl be prpeared for rapidly-changing road conditions. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
